IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO ASSIST RURAL PEOPLE TO IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE IN THEIR COMMUNITIES.
IRS990.MissionDesc: TO PROVIDE TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO SMALL RURAL COMMUNITY WATER, WASTEWATER AND SOLID WASTE STATEMENTS.
IRS990.Desc: DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE (USDA), RURAL DEVELOPMENT (RD) RURAL UTILITIES SERVICES (RUS), TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND TRAINING PROGRAM SERVICES ARE DIRECTED TO SMALL PUBLIC WATER, WASTEWATER AND SOLID WASTE UTILITIES THAT ARE ELIGIBLE FOR USDA-RUS INFRASTRUCTURE FUNDING OR THAT HAVE ALREADY RECEIVED THAT FUNDING. RURAL COMMUNITY ASSISTANCE PARTNERSHIP (RCAP) WORKS WITH COMMUNITIES IN NEED AS DIRECTED BY RD STATE OFFICES TO ENSURE THAT LOAN REQUIREMENTS ARE MET, TO ASSIST IN COMPETING THE APPLICATIONS AND APPROVAL PROCESS, TO PROVIDE GUIDANCE AND SUPPORT REGARDING FINANCIAL MANAGEMENT ISSUES, TO TRAIN UTILITY BOARDS AND MANAGERS REGARDING LEGAL AND FIDUCIARY REQUIREMENTS AND TO ENDURE THE PROVISION OF SAFE AND AFFORDABLE WATER, WASTEWATER AND SOLID WASTE SERVICES WITHIN THE COMMUNITY.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY WATER SYSTEM COMPLIANCE AND PRIVATE WATER WELL ASSISTANCE. RCAP WORKS WITH SMALL COMMUNITIES (UNDER 3,300 POPULATIONS) TO ASSIST WITH STATE AND EPA REGULATORY REQUIREMENTS UNDER THE SAFE DRINKING WATER ACT AND THE CLEAN WATER ACT. SERVICES INCLUDE DIRECT ON-SITE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND TRAINING FOR UTILITY STAFF, ELECTED OFFICIALS AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS. RCAP ALSO PROVIDES SERVICES TO PRIVATE WATER WELL OWNERS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: RCAP PERFORMED AN EVALUATION OF UNCERTAINTY IN INCOME TAXES FOR THE YEAR ENDED SEPTEMBER 30, 2018, AND DETERMINED THAT THERE WERE NO MATTERS THAT WOULD REQUIRE RECOGNITION IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS OR THAT MAY HAVE ANY EFFECT ON ITS TAX-EXEMPT STATUS.

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrantTxt: TO PROVIDE ON-SITE ASSISTANCE TO SMALL COMMUNITIES IN THE RESPECTIVE REGION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PROJECT MANAGERS ARE ASSIGNED TO EACH GRANT PROGRAM AND THEY MAINTAIN CONSTANT CONTACT WITH THE REGIONS AND OTHER SUB-RECIPIENTS. THERE IS A CENTRALIZED DATA BASE WHERE ALL PROJECT INFORMATION IS MAINTAINED. OTHER OVERSIGHT IS DONE THROUGH QUARTERLY FINANCIAL REPORTING, QUARTERLY MEETINGS WITH REGIONAL MANAGERS, SITE VISITS, FINANCIAL REVIEWS AND INDEPENDENT AUDITS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CHARTER MEMBERSHIP IN RCAP IS LIMITED TO THE FOLLOWING SIX REGIONAL ORGANIZATIONS: COMMUNITIES UNLIMITED, FAYETTEVILLE, ARKANSAS; MIDWEST ASSISTANCE PROGRAM, INC., MARYVILLE, MISSOURI; RURAL COMMUNITY ASSISTANCE CORPORATION, INC., WEST SACRAMENTO, CALIFORNIA; SOUTHEAST RURAL COMMUNITY ASSISTANCE PROJECT, INC., ROANOKE, VIRGINIA; GREAT LAKES COMMUNITY ACTION PARTNERSHIP, FREMONT, OHIO; AND RCAP SOLUTIONS, INC., GARDNER, MASSACHUSETTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EACH CHARTER MEMBER SHALL NAME ONE DIRECTOR AND AN ALTERNATE TO REPRESENT THE CHARTER MEMBER ORGANIZATION ON THE RCAP BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 8B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THERE SHALL BE NO COMMITTEE THAT CAN ACT ON BEHALF OF THE RCAP BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE DRAFT FORM 990 IS PROVIDED TO THE AUDIT COMMITTEE FOR REVIEW AND THEN ANY RECOMMENDATIONS ARE FORWARDED TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS FOR FINAL REVIEW AND ACTION. THE ENTIRE BOARD OF DIRECTORS RECEIVES A COPY OF THE DRAFT FORM 990 PRIOR TO FILING WITH THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: IN CONNECTION WITH ANY ACTUAL OR POSSIBLE CONFLICT OF INTEREST OR CONFLICT OF LOYALTY, AN INTERESTED PERSON (ANY BOARD DIRECTOR, ANY EMPLOYEE, WHO HAS A DIRECT OR INDIRECT FINANCIAL INTEREST) MUST DISCLOSE THE EXISTENCE OF THE FINANCIAL OR LOYALTY INTEREST AND BE GIVEN THE OPPORTUNITY TO DISCLOSE ALL MATERIAL FACTS TO THE DIRECTORS AND MEMBERS OF COMMITTEES WITH GOVERNING BOARD DELEGATED POWERS CONSIDERING THE PROPOSED TRANSACTION OR ARRANGEMENT. CONFLICT OF INTEREST DISCLOSURE STATEMENTS ARE REQUIRED EACH YEAR AND, DURING BOARD DELIBERATIONS WHERE MAJOR EXPENDITURES ARE DISCUSSED, DISCLOSURE IS RE-EMPHASIZED. IF A CONFLICT OF INTEREST ARISES, RCAP WILL FOLLOW THE PROCEDURES AS STATED IN THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: INDEPENDENT PERSONS DECIDED THE COMPENSATION USING COMPARABILITY DATA WHEN THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR WAS INITIALLY HIRED. THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR HAS RECEIVED INCREASES BASED ON COMPARABILITY DATA, WITH REVIEW AND APPROVAL BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS FOR COST OF LIVING AND MERIT.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: RCAP'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
